step.cmd: Export the certificate into a local file

substep.cmd: Point your HTTPS-aware Web browser to the repository URL.

stepresult.p: If this is your first visit to the repository it will be displayed a security alert stating that the security certificate presented by the server is not trusted.

substep.cmd: Go to menu Tools Internet Options .

substep.stepresult: This will open Trusted sites dialog.

substep.cmd: Add repository URL to Websites list.
Close Trusted sites dialog and Internet Options dialog.
Try again to connect to the same repository URL in Internet Explorer.
substep.stepresult: The same error page as above will be displayed.

substep.cmd: Select Continue to this website option.
substep.stepresult: A clickable area with a red icon and text Certificate Error is added to Internet Explorer address bar.
A dialog containing View certificates link is displayed.

substep.cmd: Select Details tab of Certificate dialog.
Follow indications of wizard for DER encoded binary X.509 certificate. Save certificate to local file server.cer.

step.cmd: Import the local file into the JRE running .

substep.cmd: Open a text-mode console with administrative rights.

Go to the lib/security directory of the JRE running . You find the home directory of the JRE in the java.home property that is displayed in the About dialog, Installation Details, System properties tab. On Mac OS X systems, the lib/security directory is usually located in
/System/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/1.6.0.jdk/Contents/Home directory.

substep.info: ..\..\bin\keytool -import -trustcacerts -file server.cer -keystore cacertsThe server.cer file contains the server certificate, created during the previous step. keytool requires a password before adding the certificate to the JRE keystore. The default password is changeit. If somebody changed the default password then he is the only one who can perform the import.

info.note: To make accept a certificate even if it is invalid, go to the Options Preferences Connection settings HTTP(S)/WebDAV preferences page and enable the Automatically accept a security certificate, even if invalid option.
